properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: A domain name for which the certificate should be issued

properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: A domain name for which the certificate should be issued

properties.name: subject_alternative_names
properties.description: A list of domains that should be SANs in the issued certificate

properties.name: validation_method
properties.description: Which method to use for validation. DNS or EMAIL are valid, NONE can be used for certificates that were imported into ACM and then into Terraform.

properties.name: private_key
properties.description: The certificate's PEM-formatted private key

properties.name: private_key
properties.description: The certificate's PEM-formatted private key

properties.name: certificate_body
properties.description: The certificate's PEM-formatted public key

properties.name: certificate_chain
properties.description: The certificate's PEM-formatted chain

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: certificate_arn
properties.description: The ARN of the certificate that is being validated.

properties.name: validation_record_fqdns
properties.description: List of FQDNs that implement the validation. Only valid for DNS validation method ACM certificates. If this is set, the resource can implement additional sanity checks and has an explicit dependency on the resource that is implementing the validation

properties.name: certificate_authority_configuration
properties.description: Nested argument containing algorithms and certificate subject information. Defined below.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Whether the certificate authority is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

properties.name: revocation_configuration
properties.description: Nested argument containing revocation configuration. Defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: Specifies a key-value map of user-defined tags that are attached to the certificate authority.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the certificate authority. Currently, this must be SUBORDINATE.

properties.name: permanent_deletion_time_in_days
properties.description: The number of days to make a CA restorable after it has been deleted, must be between 7 to 30 days, with default to 30 days.

properties.name: cloudwatch_role_arn
properties.description: The ARN of an IAM role for CloudWatch (to allow logging & monitoring

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the API key

properties.name: description
properties.description: The API key description. Defaults to "Managed by Terraform".

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Specifies whether the API key can be used by callers. Defaults to true.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the API key. If not specified, it will be automatically generated by AWS on creation.

properties.name: authorizer_uri
properties.description: The authorizer's Uniform Resource Identifier (URI

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the authorizer

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: identity_source
properties.description: The source of the identity in an incoming request. Defaults to method.request.header.Authorization. For REQUEST type, this may be a comma-separated list of values, including headers, query string parameters and stage variables - e.g. "method.request.header.SomeHeaderName,method.request.querystring.SomeQueryStringName,stageVariables.SomeStageVariableName"

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the authorizer. Possible values are TOKEN for a Lambda function using a single authorization token submitted in a custom header, REQUEST for a Lambda function using incoming request parameters, or COGNITO_USER_POOLS for using an Amazon Cognito user pool. Defaults to TOKEN.

properties.name: authorizer_credentials
properties.description:
The credentials required for the authorizer.
To specify an IAM Role for API Gateway to assume, use the IAM Role ARN.

properties.name: authorizer_result_ttl_in_seconds
properties.description: The TTL of cached authorizer results in seconds. Defaults to 300.

properties.name: identity_validation_expression
properties.description: A validation expression for the incoming identity. For TOKEN type, this value should be a regular expression. The incoming token from the client is matched against this expression, and will proceed if the token matches. If the token doesn't match, the client receives a 401 Unauthorized response.

properties.name: provider_arns
properties.description: A list of the Amazon Cognito user pool ARNs. Each element is of this format: arn:aws:cognito-idp:{region}:{account_id}:userpool/{user_pool_id}.

properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: The already-registered domain name to connect the API to.

properties.name: api_id
properties.description: The id of the API to connect.

properties.name: stage_name
properties.description: The name of a specific deployment stage to expose at the given path. If omitted, callers may select any stage by including its name as a path element after the base path.

properties.name: base_path
properties.description: Path segment that must be prepended to the path when accessing the API via this mapping. If omitted, the API is exposed at the root of the given domain.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the client certificate.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: stage_name
properties.description: The name of the stage. If the specified stage already exists, it will be updated to point to the new deployment. If the stage does not exist, a new one will be created and point to this deployment.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the deployment

properties.name: stage_description
properties.description: The description of the stage

properties.name: variables
properties.description: A map that defines variables for the stage

properties.name: location
properties.description: The location of the targeted API entity of the to-be-created documentation part. See below.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: A content map of API-specific key-value pairs describing the targeted API entity. The map must be encoded as a JSON string, e.g., "{ \"description\": \"The API does ...\" }". Only Swagger-compliant key-value pairs can be exported and, hence, published.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated Rest API

properties.name: version
properties.description: The version identifier of the API documentation snapshot.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated Rest API

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the API documentation version.

properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: The fully-qualified domain name to register

properties.name: endpoint_configuration
properties.description: Configuration block defining API endpoint information including type. Defined below.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The string identifier of the associated REST API.

properties.name: response_type
properties.description: The response type of the associated GatewayResponse.

properties.name: status_code
properties.description: The HTTP status code of the Gateway Response.

properties.name: response_parameters
properties.description: A map specifying the templates used to transform the response body.

properties.name: response_templates
properties.description: A map specifying the parameters (paths, query strings and headers

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API.

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The API resource ID.

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: The HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTION, ANY

properties.name: integration_http_method
properties.description: The integration HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTION

properties.name: type
properties.description: The integration input's type. Valid values are HTTP (for HTTP backends

properties.name: connection_type
properties.description: The integration input's connectionType. Valid values are INTERNET (default for connections through the public routable internet

properties.name: connection_id
properties.description: The id of the VpcLink used for the integration. Required if connection_type is VPC_LINK

properties.name: uri
properties.description: The input's URI. Required if type is AWS, AWS_PROXY, HTTP or HTTP_PROXY. For HTTP integrations, the URI must be a fully formed, encoded HTTP(S

properties.name: credentials
properties.description: The credentials required for the integration. For AWS integrations, 2 options are available. To specify an IAM Role for Amazon API Gateway to assume, use the role's ARN. To require that the caller's identity be passed through from the request, specify the string arn:aws:iam::\*:user/\*.

properties.name: request_templates
properties.description: A map of the integration's request templates.

properties.name: request_parameters
properties.description: A map of request query string parameters and headers that should be passed to the backend responder. For example: request_parameters = { "integration.request.header.X-Some-Other-Header" = "method.request.header.X-Some-Header" }

properties.name: passthrough_behavior
properties.description: The integration passthrough behavior (WHEN_NO_MATCH, WHEN_NO_TEMPLATES, NEVER

properties.name: cache_key_parameters
properties.description: A list of cache key parameters for the integration.

properties.name: cache_namespace
properties.description: The integration's cache namespace.

properties.name: content_handling
properties.description: Specifies how to handle request payload content type conversions. Supported values are CONVERT_TO_BINARY and CONVERT_TO_TEXT. If this property is not defined, the request payload will be passed through from the method request to integration request without modification, provided that the passthroughBehaviors is configured to support payload pass-through.

properties.name: timeout_milliseconds
properties.description: Custom timeout between 50 and 29,000 milliseconds. The default value is 29,000 milliseconds.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The API resource ID

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: The HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS, ANY

properties.name: status_code
properties.description: The HTTP status code

properties.name: selection_pattern
properties.description: Specifies the regular expression pattern used to choose an integration response based on the response from the backend. Setting this to - makes the integration the default one. If the backend is an AWS Lambda function, the AWS Lambda function error header is matched. For all other HTTP and AWS backends, the HTTP status code is matched.

properties.name: response_templates
properties.description: A map specifying the templates used to transform the integration response body

properties.name: response_parameters
properties.description: A map of response parameters that can be read from the backend response. For example: response_parameters = { "method.response.header.X-Some-Header" = "integration.response.header.X-Some-Other-Header" }

properties.name: content_handling
properties.description: Specifies how to handle request payload content type conversions. Supported values are CONVERT_TO_BINARY and CONVERT_TO_TEXT. If this property is not defined, the response payload will be passed through from the integration response to the method response without modification.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The API resource ID

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: The HTTP Method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS, ANY

properties.name: authorization
properties.description: The type of authorization used for the method (NONE, CUSTOM, AWS_IAM, COGNITO_USER_POOLS

properties.name: authorizer_id
properties.description: The authorizer id to be used when the authorization is CUSTOM or COGNITO_USER_POOLS

properties.name: authorization_scopes
properties.description: The authorization scopes used when the authorization is COGNITO_USER_POOLS

properties.name: api_key_required
properties.description: Specify if the method requires an API key

properties.name: request_models
properties.description: A map of the API models used for the request's content type where key is the content type (e.g. application/json

properties.name: request_validator_id
properties.description: The ID of a aws_api_gateway_request_validator

properties.name: request_parameters
properties.description: A map of request query string parameters and headers that should be passed to the integration. For example: request_parameters = {"method.request.header.X-Some-Header" = true "method.request.querystring.some-query-param" = true} would define that the header X-Some-Header and the query string some-query-param must be provided in the request

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The API resource ID

properties.name: http_method
properties.description: The HTTP Method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS, ANY

properties.name: status_code
properties.description: The HTTP status code

properties.name: response_models
properties.description: A map of the API models used for the response's content type

properties.name: response_parameters
properties.description: A map of response parameters that can be sent to the caller. For example: response_parameters = { "method.response.header.X-Some-Header" = true } would define that the header X-Some-Header can be provided on the response.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the REST API

properties.name: stage_name
properties.description: The name of the stage

properties.name: method_path
properties.description: Method path defined as {resource_path}/{http_method} for an individual method override, or */* for overriding all methods in the stage.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: The settings block, see below.

properties.name: validate_request_body
properties.description: Boolean whether to validate request body. Defaults to false.

properties.name: validate_request_parameters
properties.description: Boolean whether to validate request parameters. Defaults to false.

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: parent_id
properties.description: The ID of the parent API resource

properties.name: path_part
properties.description: The last path segment of this API resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the REST API

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the REST API

properties.name: endpoint_configuration
properties.description: Nested argument defining API endpoint configuration including endpoint type. Defined below.

properties.name: binary_media_types
properties.description: The list of binary media types supported by the RestApi. By default, the RestApi supports only UTF-8-encoded text payloads.

properties.name: minimum_compression_size
properties.description: Minimum response size to compress for the REST API. Integer between -1 and 10485760 (10MB

properties.name: body
properties.description: An OpenAPI specification that defines the set of routes and integrations to create as part of the REST API.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: JSON formatted policy document that controls access to the API Gateway. For more information about building AWS IAM policy documents with Terraform, see the AWS IAM Policy Document Guide

properties.name: api_key_source
properties.description: The source of the API key for requests. Valid values are HEADER (default

properties.name: rest_api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated REST API

properties.name: stage_name
properties.description: The name of the stage

properties.name: deployment_id
properties.description: The ID of the deployment that the stage points to

properties.name: access_log_settings
properties.description: Enables access logs for the API stage. Detailed below.

properties.name: cache_cluster_enabled
properties.description: Specifies whether a cache cluster is enabled for the stage

properties.name: cache_cluster_size
properties.description: The size of the cache cluster for the stage, if enabled. Allowed values include 0.5, 1.6, 6.1, 13.5, 28.4, 58.2, 118 and 237.

properties.name: client_certificate_id
properties.description: The identifier of a client certificate for the stage.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the stage

properties.name: documentation_version
properties.description: The version of the associated API documentation

properties.name: variables
properties.description: A map that defines the stage variables

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: xray_tracing_enabled
properties.description: Whether active tracing with X-ray is enabled. Defaults to false.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the usage plan.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of a usage plan.

properties.name: api_stages
properties.description: The associated API stages of the usage plan.

properties.name: quota_settings
properties.description: The quota settings of the usage plan.

properties.name: throttle_settings
properties.description: The throttling limits of the usage plan.

properties.name: product_code
properties.description: The AWS Markeplace product identifier to associate with the usage plan as a SaaS product on AWS Marketplace.

properties.name: key_id
properties.description: The identifier of the API key resource.

properties.name: key_type
properties.description: The type of the API key resource. Currently, the valid key type is API_KEY.

properties.name: usage_plan_id
properties.description: The Id of the usage plan resource representing to associate the key to.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name used to label and identify the VPC link.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the VPC link.

properties.name: target_arns
properties.description: The list of network load balancer arns in the VPC targeted by the VPC link. Currently AWS only supports 1 target.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the policy.

properties.name: policy_type
properties.description: For DynamoDB, only TargetTrackingScaling is supported. For Amazon ECS, Spot Fleet, and Amazon RDS, both StepScaling and TargetTrackingScaling are supported. For any other service, only StepScaling is supported. Defaults to StepScaling.

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The resource type and unique identifier string for the resource associated with the scaling policy. Documentation can be found in the ResourceId parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

properties.name: scalable_dimension
properties.description: The scalable dimension of the scalable target. Documentation can be found in the ScalableDimension parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

properties.name: service_namespace
properties.description: The AWS service namespace of the scalable target. Documentation can be found in the ServiceNamespace parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

properties.name: step_scaling_policy_configuration
properties.description: Step scaling policy configuration, requires policy_type = "StepScaling" (default

properties.name: target_tracking_scaling_policy_configuration
properties.description: A target tracking policy, requires policy_type = "TargetTrackingScaling". See supported fields below.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the scheduled action.

properties.name: service_namespace
properties.description: The namespace of the AWS service. Documentation can be found in the parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference Example: ecs

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The identifier of the resource associated with the scheduled action. Documentation can be found in the parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

properties.name: scalable_dimension
properties.description: The scalable dimension. Documentation can be found in the parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference Example: ecs:service:DesiredCount

properties.name: scalable_target_action
properties.description: The new minimum and maximum capacity. You can set both values or just one. See below

properties.name: schedule
properties.description: The schedule for this action. The following formats are supported: At expressions - at(yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: The date and time for the scheduled action to start. Specify the following format: 2006-01-02T15:04:05Z

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: The date and time for the scheduled action to end. Specify the following format: 2006-01-02T15:04:05Z

properties.name: max_capacity
properties.description: The max capacity of the scalable target.

properties.name: min_capacity
properties.description: The min capacity of the scalable target.

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: The resource type and unique identifier string for the resource associated with the scaling policy. Documentation can be found in the ResourceId parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

properties.name: role_arn
properties.description:
The ARN of the IAM role that allows Application
AutoScaling to modify your scalable target on your behalf.

properties.name: scalable_dimension
properties.description: The scalable dimension of the scalable target. Documentation can be found in the ScalableDimension parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

properties.name: service_namespace
properties.description: The AWS service namespace of the scalable target. Documentation can be found in the ServiceNamespace parameter at: AWS Application Auto Scaling API Reference

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name to use for the service mesh.

properties.name: spec
properties.description: The service mesh specification to apply.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name to use for the route.

properties.name: mesh_name
properties.description: The name of the service mesh in which to create the route.

properties.name: virtual_router_name
properties.description: The name of the virtual router in which to create the route.

properties.name: spec
properties.description: The route specification to apply.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name to use for the virtual service.

properties.name: mesh_name
properties.description: The name of the service mesh in which to create the virtual service.

properties.name: spec
properties.description: The virtual service specification to apply.

properties.name: api_id
properties.description: The API ID for the GraphQL API for the DataSource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A user-supplied name for the DataSource.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the DataSource. Valid values: AWS_LAMBDA, AMAZON_DYNAMODB, AMAZON_ELASTICSEARCH, HTTP, NONE.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A description of the DataSource.

properties.name: service_role_arn
properties.description: The IAM service role ARN for the data source.

properties.name: dynamodb_config
properties.description: DynamoDB settings. See below

properties.name: elasticsearch_config
properties.description: Amazon Elasticsearch settings. See below

properties.name: http_config
properties.description: HTTP settings. See below

properties.name: lambda_config
properties.description: AWS Lambda settings. See below

properties.name: authentication_type
properties.description: The authentication type. Valid values: API_KEY, AWS_IAM, AMAZON_COGNITO_USER_POOLS, OPENID_CONNECT

properties.name: name
properties.description: A user-supplied name for the GraphqlApi.

properties.name: log_config
properties.description: Nested argument containing logging configuration. Defined below.

properties.name: openid_connect_config
properties.description: Nested argument containing OpenID Connect configuration. Defined below.

properties.name: user_pool_config
properties.description: The Amazon Cognito User Pool configuration. Defined below.

properties.name: schema
properties.description: The schema definition, in GraphQL schema language format. Terraform cannot perform drift detection of this configuration.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: api_id
properties.description: The ID of the associated AppSync API

properties.name: description
properties.description: The API key description. Defaults to "Managed by Terraform".

properties.name: expires
properties.description: RFC3339 string representation of the expiry date. Rounded down to nearest hour. By default, it is 7 days from the date of creation.

properties.name: api_id
properties.description: The API ID for the GraphQL API.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type name from the schema defined in the GraphQL API.

properties.name: field
properties.description: The field name from the schema defined in the GraphQL API.

properties.name: data_source
properties.description: The DataSource name.

properties.name: request_template
properties.description: The request mapping template for this resolver.

properties.name: response_template
properties.description: The response mapping template for this resolver.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the database to create.

properties.name: bucket
properties.description: Name of s3 bucket to save the results of the query execution.

properties.name: encryption_configuration
properties.description: The encryption key block AWS Athena uses to decrypt the data in S3, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS

properties.name: force_destroy
properties.description: A boolean that indicates all tables should be deleted from the database so that the database can be destroyed without error. The tables are not recoverable.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The plain language name for the query. Maximum length of 128.

properties.name: database
properties.description: The database to which the query belongs.

properties.name: query
properties.description: The text of the query itself. In other words, all query statements. Maximum length of 262144.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A brief explanation of the query. Maximum length of 1024.

properties.name: autoscaling_group_name
properties.description: Name of ASG to associate with the ELB.

properties.name: elb
properties.description: The name of the ELB.

properties.name: alb_target_group_arn
properties.description: The ARN of an ALB Target Group.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the auto scaling group. By default generated by Terraform.

properties.name: name_prefix
properties.description: Creates a unique name beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with name.

properties.name: max_size
properties.description: The maximum size of the auto scale group.

properties.name: min_size
properties.description: The minimum size of the auto scale group. (See also Waiting for Capacity below.

properties.name: availability_zones
properties.description: A list of one or more availability zones for the group. This parameter should not be specified when using vpc_zone_identifier.

properties.name: default_cooldown
properties.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before another scaling activity can start.

properties.name: launch_configuration
properties.description: The name of the launch configuration to use.

properties.name: launch_template
properties.description: Nested argument with Launch template specification to use to launch instances. Defined below.

properties.name: mixed_instances_policy
properties.description: Configuration block containing settings to define launch targets for Auto Scaling groups. Defined below.

properties.name: initial_lifecycle_hook
properties.description: One or more Lifecycle Hooks to attach to the autoscaling group before instances are launched. The syntax is exactly the same as the separate aws_autoscaling_lifecycle_hook resource, without the autoscaling_group_name attribute. Please note that this will only work when creating a new autoscaling group. For all other use-cases, please use aws_autoscaling_lifecycle_hook resource.

properties.name: health_check_grace_period
properties.description: Time (in seconds

properties.name: health_check_type
properties.description: "EC2" or "ELB". Controls how health checking is done.

properties.name: desired_capacity
properties.description: The number of Amazon EC2 instances that should be running in the group. (See also Waiting for Capacity below.

properties.name: force_delete
properties.description:
Allows deleting the autoscaling group without waiting
for all instances in the pool to terminate.  You can force an autoscaling group to delete
even if it's in the process of scaling a resource. Normally, Terraform
drains all the instances before deleting the group.  This bypasses that
behavior and potentially leaves resources dangling.

properties.name: load_balancers
properties.description: A list of elastic load balancer names to add to the autoscaling group names. Only valid for classic load balancers. For ALBs, use target_group_arns instead.

properties.name: vpc_zone_identifier
properties.description: A list of subnet IDs to launch resources in.

properties.name: target_group_arns
properties.description: A list of aws_alb_target_group ARNs, for use with Application Load Balancing.

properties.name: termination_policies
properties.description: A list of policies to decide how the instances in the auto scale group should be terminated. The allowed values are OldestInstance, NewestInstance, OldestLaunchConfiguration, ClosestToNextInstanceHour, OldestLaunchTemplate, AllocationStrategy, Default.

properties.name: suspended_processes
properties.description: A list of processes to suspend for the AutoScaling Group. The allowed values are Launch, Terminate, HealthCheck, ReplaceUnhealthy, AZRebalance, AlarmNotification, ScheduledActions, AddToLoadBalancer. Note that if you suspend either the Launch or Terminate process types, it can prevent your autoscaling group from functioning properly.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: A list of tag blocks. Tags documented below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A list of tag blocks (maps

properties.name: placement_group
properties.description: The name of the placement group into which you'll launch your instances, if any.

properties.name: metrics_granularity
properties.description: The granularity to associate with the metrics to collect. The only valid value is 1Minute. Default is 1Minute.

properties.name: enabled_metrics
properties.description: A list of metrics to collect. The allowed values are GroupMinSize, GroupMaxSize, GroupDesiredCapacity, GroupInServiceInstances, GroupPendingInstances, GroupStandbyInstances, GroupTerminatingInstances, GroupTotalInstances.

properties.name: wait_for_capacity_timeout
properties.default: : "10m") A maximum duration that Terraform should wait for ASG instances to be healthy before timing out. (See also Waiting for Capacity below.) Setting this to "0" causes Terraform to skip all Capacity Waiting behavior.
properties.description: A maximum duration that Terraform should wait for ASG instances to be healthy before timing out. (See also Waiting for Capacity below.

properties.name: min_elb_capacity
properties.description: Setting this causes Terraform to wait for this number of instances from this autoscaling group to show up healthy in the ELB only on creation. Updates will not wait on ELB instance number changes. (See also Waiting for Capacity below.

properties.name: wait_for_elb_capacity
properties.description: Setting this will cause Terraform to wait for exactly this number of healthy instances from this autoscaling group in all attached load balancers on both create and update operations. (Takes precedence over min_elb_capacity behavior.

properties.name: protect_from_scale_in
properties.description:
Allows setting instance protection. The
autoscaling group will not select instances with this setting for terminination
during scale in events.

properties.name: service_linked_role_arn
properties.description: The ARN of the service-linked role that the ASG will use to call other AWS services

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the lifecycle hook.

properties.name: autoscaling_group_name
properties.description: The name of the Auto Scaling group to which you want to assign the lifecycle hook

properties.name: default_result
properties.description: Defines the action the Auto Scaling group should take when the lifecycle hook timeout elapses or if an unexpected failure occurs. The value for this parameter can be either CONTINUE or ABANDON. The default value for this parameter is ABANDON.

properties.name: heartbeat_timeout
properties.description: Defines the amount of time, in seconds, that can elapse before the lifecycle hook times out. When the lifecycle hook times out, Auto Scaling performs the action defined in the DefaultResult parameter

properties.name: lifecycle_transition
properties.description: The instance state to which you want to attach the lifecycle hook. For a list of lifecycle hook types, see describe-lifecycle-hook-types

properties.name: notification_metadata
properties.description: Contains additional information that you want to include any time Auto Scaling sends a message to the notification target.

properties.name: notification_target_arn
properties.description: The ARN of the notification target that Auto Scaling will use to notify you when an instance is in the transition state for the lifecycle hook. This ARN target can be either an SQS queue or an SNS topic.

properties.name: role_arn
properties.description: The ARN of the IAM role that allows the Auto Scaling group to publish to the specified notification target.

properties.name: group_names
properties.description: A list of AutoScaling Group Names

properties.name: notifications
properties.description: A list of Notification Types that trigger notifications. Acceptable values are documented in the AWS documentation here

properties.name: topic_arn
properties.description: The Topic ARN for notifications to be sent through

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the policy.

properties.name: autoscaling_group_name
properties.description: The name of the autoscaling group.

properties.name: adjustment_type
properties.description: Specifies whether the adjustment is an absolute number or a percentage of the current capacity. Valid values are ChangeInCapacity, ExactCapacity, and PercentChangeInCapacity.

properties.name: policy_type
properties.description: The policy type, either "SimpleScaling", "StepScaling" or "TargetTrackingScaling". If this value isn't provided, AWS will default to "SimpleScaling."

properties.name: estimated_instance_warmup
properties.description: The estimated time, in seconds, until a newly launched instance will contribute CloudWatch metrics. Without a value, AWS will default to the group's specified cooldown period.

properties.name: autoscaling_group_name
properties.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN

properties.name: scheduled_action_name
properties.description: The name of this scaling action.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: The time for this action to start, in "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ" format in UTC/GMT only (for example, 2014-06-01T00:00:00Z

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: The time for this action to end, in "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ" format in UTC/GMT only (for example, 2014-06-01T00:00:00Z

properties.name: recurrence
properties.description: The time when recurring future actions will start. Start time is specified by the user following the Unix cron syntax format.

properties.name: min_size
properties.description:
The minimum size for the Auto Scaling group. Default 0.
Set to -1 if you don't want to change the minimum size at the scheduled time.

properties.name: max_size
properties.description:
The maximum size for the Auto Scaling group. Default 0.
Set to -1 if you don't want to change the maximum size at the scheduled time.

properties.name: desired_capacity
properties.description: The number of EC2 instances that should be running in the group. Default 0.  Set to -1 if you don't want to change the desired capacity at the scheduled time.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The display name of a backup plan.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: A rule object that specifies a scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: Metadata that you can assign to help organize the plans you create.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The display name of a resource selection document.

properties.name: plan_id
properties.description: The backup plan ID to be associated with the selection of resources.

properties.name: iam_role_arn
properties.description: The ARN of the IAM role that AWS Backup uses to authenticate when restoring and backing up the target resource. See the AWS Backup Developer Guide for additional information about using AWS managed policies or creating custom policies attached to the IAM role.

properties.name: selection_tag
properties.description: Tag-based conditions used to specify a set of resources to assign to a backup plan.

properties.name: resources
properties.description: An array of strings that either contain Amazon Resource Names (ARNs

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the backup vault to create.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: Metadata that you can assign to help organize the resources that you create.

properties.name: kms_key_arn
properties.description: The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups.

properties.name: compute_environment_name
properties.description: The name for your compute environment. Up to 128 letters (uppercase and lowercase

properties.name: compute_resources
properties.description: Details of the compute resources managed by the compute environment. This parameter is required for managed compute environments. See details below.

properties.name: service_role
properties.description: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN

properties.name: state
properties.description: The state of the compute environment. If the state is ENABLED, then the compute environment accepts jobs from a queue and can scale out automatically based on queues. Valid items are ENABLED or DISABLED. Defaults to ENABLED.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the compute environment. Valid items are MANAGED or UNMANAGED.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Specifies the name of the job definition.

properties.name: container_properties
properties.description: A valid container properties provided as a single valid JSON document. This parameter is required if the type parameter is container.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Specifies the parameter substitution placeholders to set in the job definition.

properties.name: retry_strategy
properties.description: Specifies the retry strategy to use for failed jobs that are submitted with this job definition. Maximum number of retry_strategy is 1. Defined below.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: Specifies the timeout for jobs so that if a job runs longer, AWS Batch terminates the job. Maximum number of timeout is 1. Defined below.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of job definition. Must be container

properties.name: name
properties.description: Specifies the name of the job queue.

properties.name: compute_environments
properties.description:
Specifies the set of compute environments
mapped to a job queue and their order.  The position of the compute environments
in the list will dictate the order. You can associate up to 3 compute environments
with a job queue.

properties.name: priority
properties.description:
The priority of the job queue. Job queues with a higher priority
are evaluated first when associated with the same compute environment.

properties.name: state
properties.description: The state of the job queue. Must be one of: ENABLED or DISABLED

properties.name: account_id
properties.description: The ID of the target account for budget. Will use current user's account_id by default if omitted.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of a budget. Unique within accounts.

properties.name: name_prefix
properties.description: The prefix of the name of a budget. Unique within accounts.

properties.name: budget_type
properties.description: Whether this budget tracks monetary cost or usage.

properties.name: cost_filters
properties.description: Map of CostFilters key/value pairs to apply to the budget.

properties.name: cost_types
properties.description: Object containing CostTypes The types of cost included in a budget, such as tax and subscriptions..

properties.name: limit_amount
properties.description: The amount of cost or usage being measured for a budget.

properties.name: limit_unit
properties.description: The unit of measurement used for the budget forecast, actual spend, or budget threshold, such as dollars or GB. See Spend documentation.

properties.name: time_period_end
properties.description: The end of the time period covered by the budget. There are no restrictions on the end date. Format: 2017-01-01_12:00.

properties.name: time_period_start
properties.description: The start of the time period covered by the budget. The start date must come before the end date. Format: 2017-01-01_12:00.

properties.name: time_unit
properties.description: The length of time until a budget resets the actual and forecasted spend. Valid values: MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY.

properties.name: notification
properties.description: Object containing Budget Notifications. Can be used multiple times to define more than one budget notification

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the environment.

properties.name: instance_type
properties.description: The type of instance to connect to the environment, e.g. t2.micro.

properties.name: automatic_stop_time_minutes
properties.description: The number of minutes until the running instance is shut down after the environment has last been used.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the environment.

properties.name: owner_arn
properties.description: The ARN of the environment owner. This can be ARN of any AWS IAM principal. Defaults to the environment's creator.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: The ID of the subnet in Amazon VPC that AWS Cloud9 will use to communicate with the Amazon EC2 instance.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Stack name.

properties.name: template_body
properties.description: Structure containing the template body (max size: 51,200 bytes

properties.name: template_url
properties.description: Location of a file containing the template body (max size: 460,800 bytes

properties.name: capabilities
properties.description: A list of capabilities. Valid values: CAPABILITY_IAM, CAPABILITY_NAMED_IAM, or CAPABILITY_AUTO_EXPAND

properties.name: disable_rollback
properties.description: Set to true to disable rollback of the stack if stack creation failed. Conflicts with on_failure.

properties.name: notification_arns
properties.description: A list of SNS topic ARNs to publish stack related events.

properties.name: on_failure
properties.description: Action to be taken if stack creation fails. This must be one of: DO_NOTHING, ROLLBACK, or DELETE. Conflicts with disable_rollback.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: A map of Parameter structures that specify input parameters for the stack.

properties.name: policy_body
properties.description: Structure containing the stack policy body. Conflicts w/ policy_url.

properties.name: policy_url
properties.description: Location of a file containing the stack policy. Conflicts w/ policy_body.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A list of tags to associate with this stack.

properties.name: iam_role_arn
properties.description: The ARN of an IAM role that AWS CloudFormation assumes to create the stack. If you don't specify a value, AWS CloudFormation uses the role that was previously associated with the stack. If no role is available, AWS CloudFormation uses a temporary session that is generated from your user credentials.

properties.name: timeout_in_minutes
properties.description: The amount of time that can pass before the stack status becomes CREATE_FAILED.

properties.name: administration_role_arn
properties.description: Amazon Resource Number (ARN

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the Stack Set. The name must be unique in the region where you create your Stack Set. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters (case-sensitive

properties.name: capabilities
properties.description: A list of capabilities. Valid values: CAPABILITY_IAM, CAPABILITY_NAMED_IAM, CAPABILITY_AUTO_EXPAND.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the Stack Set.

properties.name: execution_role_name
properties.description: Name of the IAM Role in all target accounts for Stack Set operations. Defaults to AWSCloudFormationStackSetExecutionRole.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Key-value map of input parameters for the Stack Set template. All template parameters, including those with a Default, must be configured or ignored with lifecycle configuration block ignore_changes argument. All NoEcho template parameters must be ignored with the lifecycle configuration block ignore_changes argument.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: Key-value map of tags to associate with this Stack Set and the Stacks created from it. AWS CloudFormation also propagates these tags to supported resources that are created in the Stacks. A maximum number of 50 tags can be specified.

properties.name: template_body
properties.description: String containing the CloudFormation template body. Maximum size: 51,200 bytes. Conflicts with template_url.

properties.name: template_url
properties.description: String containing the location of a file containing the CloudFormation template body. The URL must point to a template that is located in an Amazon S3 bucket. Maximum location file size: 460,800 bytes. Conflicts with template_body.

properties.name: stack_set_name
properties.description: Name of the Stack Set.

properties.name: account_id
properties.description: Target AWS Account ID to create a Stack based on the Stack Set. Defaults to current account.

properties.name: parameter_overrides
properties.description: Key-value map of input parameters to override from the Stack Set for this Instance.

properties.name: region
properties.description: Target AWS Region to create a Stack based on the Stack Set. Defaults to current region.

properties.name: retain_stack
properties.description: During Terraform resource destroy, remove Instance from Stack Set while keeping the Stack and its associated resources. Must be enabled in Terraform state before destroy operation to take effect. You cannot reassociate a retained Stack or add an existing, saved Stack to a new Stack Set. Defaults to false.

properties.name: aliases
properties.description: - Extra CNAMEs (alternate domain names

properties.name: comment
properties.description: - Any comments you want to include about the distribution.

properties.name: custom_error_response
properties.description: - One or more custom error response elements (multiples allowed

properties.name: default_cache_behavior
properties.description: - The default cache behavior for this distribution (maximum one

properties.name: default_root_object
properties.description:
- The object that you want CloudFront to
return (for example, index.html

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: - Whether the distribution is enabled to accept end user requests for content.

properties.name: is_ipv6_enabled
properties.description: - Whether the IPv6 is enabled for the distribution.

properties.name: http_version
properties.description: - The maximum HTTP version to support on the distribution. Allowed values are http1.1 and http2. The default is http2.

properties.name: logging_config
properties.description: - The logging configuration that controls how logs are written to your distribution (maximum one

properties.name: ordered_cache_behavior
properties.description: - An ordered list of cache behaviors resource for this distribution. List from top to bottom in order of precedence. The topmost cache behavior will have precedence 0.

properties.name: origin
properties.description: - One or more origins for this distribution (multiples allowed

properties.name: origin_group
properties.description: - One or more origin_group for this distribution (multiples allowed

properties.name: price_class
properties.description: - The price class for this distribution. One of PriceClass_All, PriceClass_200, PriceClass_100

properties.name: restrictions
properties.description: - The restriction configuration for this distribution (maximum one

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: viewer_certificate
properties.description: - The SSL configuration for this distribution (maximum one

properties.name: web_acl_id
properties.description: - If you're using AWS WAF to filter CloudFront requests, the Id of the AWS WAF web ACL that is associated with the distribution.

properties.name: retain_on_delete
properties.description: - Disables the distribution instead of deleting it when destroying the resource through Terraform. If this is set, the distribution needs to be deleted manually afterwards. Default: false.

properties.name: wait_for_deployment
properties.description: - If enabled, the resource will wait for the distribution status to change from InProgress to Deployed. Setting this tofalse will skip the process. Default: true.

properties.name: comment
properties.description: - An optional comment for the origin access identity.

properties.name: comment
properties.description: An optional comment about the public key.

properties.name: encoded_key
properties.description: The encoded public key that you want to add to CloudFront to use with features like field-level encryption.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name for the public key. By default generated by Terraform.

properties.name: name_prefix
properties.description: The name for the public key. Conflicts with name.

properties.name: source_backup_identifier
properties.description: The id of Cloud HSM v2 cluster backup to be restored.

properties.name: hsm_type
properties.description: The type of HSM module in the cluster. Currently, only hsm1.medium is supported.

properties.name: subnet_ids
properties.description: The IDs of subnets in which cluster will operate.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: cluster_id
properties.description: The ID of Cloud HSM v2 cluster to which HSM will be added.

properties.name: subnet_id
properties.description: The ID of subnet in which HSM module will be located.

properties.name: availability_zone
properties.description: The IDs of AZ in which HSM module will be located. Do not use together with subnet_id.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: The IP address of HSM module. Must be within the CIDR of selected subnet.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Specifies the name of the trail.

properties.name: s3_bucket_name
properties.description: Specifies the name of the S3 bucket designated for publishing log files.

properties.name: s3_key_prefix
properties.description:
Specifies the S3 key prefix that follows
the name of the bucket you have designated for log file delivery.

properties.name: cloud_watch_logs_role_arn
properties.description:
Specifies the role for the CloudWatch Logs
endpoint to assume to write to a user’s log group.

properties.name: cloud_watch_logs_group_arn
properties.description: Specifies a log group name using an Amazon Resource Name (ARN

properties.name: enable_logging
properties.description: Enables logging for the trail. Defaults to true. Setting this to false will pause logging.

properties.name: include_global_service_events
properties.description: Specifies whether the trail is publishing events from global services such as IAM to the log files. Defaults to true.

properties.name: is_multi_region_trail
properties.description: Specifies whether the trail is created in the current region or in all regions. Defaults to false.

properties.name: is_organization_trail
properties.description: Specifies whether the trail is an AWS Organizations trail. Organization trails log events for the master account and all member accounts. Can only be created in the organization master account. Defaults to false.

properties.name: sns_topic_name
properties.description:
Specifies the name of the Amazon SNS topic
defined for notification of log file delivery.

properties.name: enable_log_file_validation
properties.description: Specifies whether log file integrity validation is enabled. Defaults to false.

properties.name: kms_key_id
properties.description: Specifies the KMS key ARN to use to encrypt the logs delivered by CloudTrail.

properties.name: event_selector
properties.description: Specifies an event selector for enabling data event logging. Fields documented below. Please note the CloudTrail limits when configuring these.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the trail

properties.name: dashboard_name
properties.description: The name of the dashboard.

properties.name: dashboard_body
properties.description: The detailed information about the dashboard, including what widgets are included and their location on the dashboard. You can read more about the body structure in the documentation.

properties.name: principal
properties.description: The 12-digit AWS account ID that you are permitting to put events to your default event bus. Specify * to permit any account to put events to your default event bus, optionally limited by condition.

properties.name: statement_id
properties.description: An identifier string for the external account that you are granting permissions to.

properties.name: action
properties.description: The action that you are enabling the other account to perform. Defaults to events:PutEvents.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: Configuration block to limit the event bus permissions you are granting to only accounts that fulfill the condition. Specified below.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The rule's name. By default generated by Terraform.

properties.name: name_prefix
properties.description: The rule's name. Conflicts with name.

properties.name: schedule_expression
properties.description:
The scheduling expression.
For example, <code>cron(0 20 * * ? *

properties.name: event_pattern
properties.description: Event pattern described a JSON object. See full documentation of CloudWatch Events and Event Patterns for details.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the rule.

properties.name: role_arn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN

properties.name: is_enabled
properties.description: Whether the rule should be enabled (defaults to true

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: The name of the rule you want to add targets to.

properties.name: target_id
properties.description: The unique target assignment ID.  If missing, will generate a random, unique id.

properties.name: arn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN

properties.name: input
properties.description: Valid JSON text passed to the target.

properties.name: input_path
properties.description: The value of the JSONPath that is used for extracting part of the matched event when passing it to the target.

properties.name: role_arn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN

properties.name: run_command_targets
properties.description: Parameters used when you are using the rule to invoke Amazon EC2 Run Command. Documented below. A maximum of 5 are allowed.

properties.name: ecs_target
properties.description: Parameters used when you are using the rule to invoke Amazon ECS Task. Documented below. A maximum of 1 are allowed.

properties.name: batch_target
properties.description: Parameters used when you are using the rule to invoke an Amazon Batch Job. Documented below. A maximum of 1 are allowed.

properties.name: kinesis_target
properties.description: Parameters used when you are using the rule to invoke an Amazon Kinesis Stream. Documented below. A maximum of 1 are allowed.

properties.name: sqs_target
properties.description: Parameters used when you are using the rule to invoke an Amazon SQS Queue. Documented below. A maximum of 1 are allowed.

properties.name: input_transformer
properties.description: Parameters used when you are providing a custom input to a target based on certain event data.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A name for the log destination

properties.name: role_arn
properties.description: The ARN of an IAM role that grants Amazon CloudWatch Logs permissions to put data into the target

properties.name: target_arn
properties.description: The ARN of the target Amazon Kinesis stream or Amazon Lambda resource for the destination

properties.name: destination_name
properties.description: A name for the subscription filter

properties.name: access_policy
properties.description: The policy document. This is a JSON formatted string.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the log group. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique name.

properties.name: name_prefix
properties.description: Creates a unique name beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with name.

properties.name: retention_in_days
properties.description:
Specifies the number of days
you want to retain log events in the specified log group.

properties.name: kms_key_id
properties.description:
The ARN of the KMS Key to use when encrypting log data. Please note, after the AWS KMS CMK is disassociated from the log group,
AWS CloudWatch Logs stops encrypting newly ingested data for the log group. All previously ingested data remains encrypted, and AWS CloudWatch Logs requires
permissions for the CMK whenever the encrypted data is requested.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A name for the metric filter.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: A valid CloudWatch Logs filter pattern for extracting metric data out of ingested log events.

properties.name: log_group_name
properties.description: The name of the log group to associate the metric filter with.

properties.name: metric_transformation
properties.description:
A block defining collection of information
needed to define how metric data gets emitted. See below.

properties.name: policy_document
properties.description: Details of the resource policy, including the identity of the principal that is enabled to put logs to this account. This is formatted as a JSON string. Maximum length of 5120 characters.

properties.name: policy_name
properties.description: Name of the resource policy.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the log stream. Must not be longer than 512 characters and must not contain :

properties.name: log_group_name
properties.description: The name of the log group under which the log stream is to be created.

properties.name: name
properties.description: A name for the subscription filter

properties.name: destination_arn
properties.description: The ARN of the destination to deliver matching log events to. Kinesis stream or Lambda function ARN.

properties.name: filter_pattern
properties.description: A valid CloudWatch Logs filter pattern for subscribing to a filtered stream of log events.

properties.name: log_group_name
properties.description: The name of the log group to associate the subscription filter with

properties.name: role_arn
properties.description: The ARN of an IAM role that grants Amazon CloudWatch Logs permissions to deliver ingested log events to the destination. If you use Lambda as a destination, you should skip this argument and use aws_lambda_permission resource for granting access from CloudWatch logs to the destination Lambda function.

properties.name: distribution
properties.description: The method used to distribute log data to the destination. By default log data is grouped by log stream, but the grouping can be set to random for a more even distribution. This property is only applicable when the destination is an Amazon Kinesis stream. Valid values are "Random" and "ByLogStream".

properties.name: alarm_name
properties.description: The descriptive name for the alarm. This name must be unique within the user's AWS account

properties.name: comparison_operator
properties.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified Statistic and Threshold. The specified Statistic value is used as the first operand. Either of the following is supported: GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold, GreaterThanThreshold, LessThanThreshold, LessThanOrEqualToThreshold.

properties.name: evaluation_periods
properties.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: The name for the alarm's associated metric. See docs for supported metrics.

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: The namespace for the alarm's associated metric. See docs for the list of namespaces. See docs for supported metrics.

properties.name: period
properties.description: The period in seconds over which the specified statistic is applied.

properties.name: statistic
properties.description: The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric. Either of the following is supported: SampleCount, Average, Sum, Minimum, Maximum

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

properties.name: actions_enabled
properties.description: Indicates whether or not actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm's state. Defaults to true.

properties.name: alarm_actions
properties.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN

properties.name: alarm_description
properties.description: The description for the alarm.

properties.name: datapoints_to_alarm
properties.description: The number of datapoints that must be breaching to trigger the alarm.

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description: The dimensions for the alarm's associated metric. For the list of available dimensions see the AWS documentation here.

properties.name: insufficient_data_actions
properties.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN

properties.name: ok_actions
properties.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an OK state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN

properties.name: unit
properties.description: The unit for the alarm's associated metric.

properties.name: extended_statistic
properties.description: The percentile statistic for the metric associated with the alarm. Specify a value between p0.0 and p100.

properties.name: treat_missing_data
properties.description: Sets how this alarm is to handle missing data points. The following values are supported: missing, ignore, breaching and notBreaching. Defaults to missing.

properties.name: evaluate_low_sample_count_percentiles
properties.description: Used only for alarms based on percentiles. If you specify ignore, the alarm state will not change during periods with too few data points to be statistically significant. If you specify evaluate or omit this parameter, the alarm will always be evaluated and possibly change state no matter how many data points are available. The following values are supported: ignore, and evaluate.

properties.name: metric_query
properties.description: Enables you to create an alarm based on a metric math expression. You may specify at most 20.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: artifacts
properties.description: Information about the project's build output artifacts. Artifact blocks are documented below.

properties.name: environment
properties.description: Information about the project's build environment. Environment blocks are documented below.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The projects name.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Information about the project's input source code. Source blocks are documented below.

properties.name: badge_enabled
properties.description: Generates a publicly-accessible URL for the projects build badge. Available as badge_url attribute when enabled.

properties.name: build_timeout
properties.description: How long in minutes, from 5 to 480 (8 hours

properties.name: cache
properties.description: Information about the cache storage for the project. Cache blocks are documented below.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A short description of the project.

properties.name: encryption_key
properties.description: The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS

properties.description: Options for how AWS Config delivers configuration snapshots. See below

properties.name: report_name
properties.description: Unique name for the report. Must start with a number/letter and is case sensitive. Limited to 256 characters.

properties.name: time_unit
properties.description: The frequency on which report data are measured and displayed.  Valid values are: HOURLY, DAILY.

properties.name: format
properties.description: Format for report. Valid values are: textORcsv.

properties.name: compression
properties.description: Compression format for report. Valid values are: GZIP, ZIP.

properties.name: additional_schema_elements
properties.description: A list of schema elements. Valid values are: RESOURCES.

properties.name: s3_bucket
properties.description: Name of the existing S3 bucket to hold generated reports.

properties.name: s3_prefix
properties.description: Report path prefix. Limited to 256 characters.

properties.name: s3_region
properties.description: Region of the existing S3 bucket to hold generated reports.

properties.name: additional_artifacts
properties.description: A list of additional artifacts. Valid values are: REDSHIFT, QUICKSIGHT.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A description for the DLM lifecycle policy.

properties.name: execution_role_arn
properties.description: The ARN of an IAM role that is able to be assumed by the DLM service.

properties.name: policy_details
properties.description: See the policy_details configuration block. Max of 1.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Whether the lifecycle policy should be enabled or disabled. ENABLED or DISABLED are valid values. Defaults to ENABLED.
